definition:
to inflict with physical pain : wound                                      
             
             He hurt his back while moving some boxes.

to do substantial or material harm to : damage                                      
             
             the dry summer has hurt the land

to cause emotional pain or anguish to : offend                                      
             
             never meant to hurt you

to be detrimental to : hamper                                      
             
             charges of graft hurt his chances of being elected

to suffer pain or grief                                      
             
             He says his tooth hurts.

to be in need                                      
                
                  —usually used with for          hurting for money

to cause damage or distress                                      
             
             hit where it hurts

a cause of injury or damage : blow                                      
             
             this tower of granite, weathering the hurts of so many ages
a bodily injury or wound

mental or emotional distress or anguish : suffering                                      
             
             getting past the hurt of a bitter divorce

wrong, harm                                      
             
             subordinating cosmic to moral considerations, to the hurt of both
to cause pain or injury to (yourself, someone else, or a part of your body)
to be a source or cause of pain
to feel physical pain
mental or emotional pain

to feel or cause pain                                      
             
             My feet hurt.

to do harm to : damage                                      
             
             The drought has hurt crops.

to cause to be sad                                      
             
             "I am sure none of my boys and girls in Room 13 would purposely … hurt anyone's feelings …"

to make poorer or more difficult                                      
             
             The fumble hurt our team's chance of winning.
an injury or wound to the body

physically or emotionally injured                                      
             
             a hurt toe
in: He hurt his back while moving some boxes.
was seriously hurt in a car accident
You're hurting my arm!
the dry summer has hurt the land
never meant to hurt you
got her feelings hurt
charges of graft hurt his chances of being elected
He says his tooth hurts.
has been hurting ever since learning of her friend's betrayal
hurting for money
hit where it hurts
this tower of granite, weathering the hurts of so many ages
getting past the hurt of a bitter divorce
subordinating cosmic to moral considerations, to the hurt of both
badly injured in an accident
careful not to harm the animals
hurt by their callous remarks
a table damaged in shipping
years of smoking had impaired his health
the text is marred by many typos
Be careful with that knife or you could hurt yourself.
Ouch! You're hurting my arm!
She was badly hurt in a car accident.
My tooth still hurts me.
When I woke up this morning I hurt all over.
Their lack of interest in her work hurt her deeply.
You're only hurting yourself by holding a grudge against them.
It hurt me to see her go.
The lack of rain has hurt the corn crop.
If we lose this game it will seriously hurt our chances of making the play-offs.
Her sympathy eased the hurt he felt after his dog's death.
They felt a great hurt after their bitter divorce.
She tried to put past hurts behind her.
My feet hurt.
These shoes hurt.
The drought has hurt crops.
"I am sure none of my boys and girls in Room 13 would purposely … hurt anyone's feelings …"
The fumble hurt our team's chance of winning.
a hurt toe
hurt feelings

definition: to feel pain somewhere in your body
to cause physical pain or injury
to cause someone emotional pain
to cause damage or problems, or to harm someone’s chance to succeed at something
in: Fred’s knees hurt after skiing all day.
You’re hurting my arm!
These new boots hurt.
hurt yourself doing something: Don’t hurt yourself exercising.
I never meant to hurt your feelings.
His cold behaviour hurt her deeply.
it hurts that: It really hurts that you’d believe her instead of me.
Oil spills hurt everyone.
The weakness of the dollar has hurt car sales.
computer equipment that won’t hurt your wallet  (=cost a lot)
be hurting
it never hurts to do something
it won’t hurt you to do something
where it hurts
something will not/does not/cannot hurt
someone wouldn’t hurt a fly

definition: to feel pain in a part of your body, or to injure someone or cause them pain:
to cause emotional pain to someone:
to cause harm or difficulty:
injured or in pain:
upset or unhappy:
emotional pain:
to feel pain, or to cause pain or injury to yourself or someone else:
To hurt also means to cause harm or difficulty:
To hurt someone can also mean to make someone upset or unhappy:
feeling pain or being upset:
in: Tell me where it hurts.
My head hurts.
She says that her ear hurts her.

One more drink won't hurt (= won't cause any harm).

My leg hurts.
Stop! You’re hurting me!
